intro: Struthanthus pedunculatus, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has hairy, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are typically tubular with five petals and produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Struthanthus pedunculatus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
